website_summaries.verdict: It's hard to top this Chemex coffee maker's beauty and durability thanks the hand-blown glass; but others on our shortlist are either less costly or more spacious.
pros: This beautiful coffee maker is a classic hand-blown model that's typical of the brand's original superior craftsmanship
Comes with a wood collar and leather tie
cons: Small capacity - only capable of making 1 to 3 cups of coffee at a time
One of the more costly coffee makers by the brand

customer_reviews.title: to any new customer watch out for them switching from a handblown to a classic
customer_reviews.text: I supposed to have received a 8 cup handlblown Chemex $82 But I received a classic 8 cup instead, the classi ccost $36 and I've seen this happening many times on Amazon reviews, it should be very easy for somebody to recognize the difference between classic and handblown, handblown well way in at two or three times the weight of the classic. Right now I'm trying to get with Amazon to get a refund of $ 82 ,and I already went in and ordered a new handblown $82 unit that I will receive on Thursday, I hope. But the way I already have a classic 8 cup and I do not need a second unit.
customer_reviews.author: Good frame

customer_reviews.title: READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews about receiving a Classic Chemex instead of the Handblown model, but gambled on it anyway. Got a Classic Chemex. Not sure what I expected. The Classic version is roughly $50 cheaper. Had to contact Amazon and get a refund. Either just order the Classic version or find something else. Save your time/money and pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT Handblown
customer_reviews.text: Same thing as the other reviewers, it's not the handblown one. The box says it's the Classic with a model number of CM-8A. I just broke my classic 8-cup Chemex I had for the last 5 years and this new one doesn't quite look the same. First of all, there isn't a seam like my old one and the bottom of the pot has "CHEMEX" stamped on the bottom. My old one has an "X" shaped logo that is a molded into the glass. These changes appear to be an update they made recently. Either way, it's not the handblown one and it cost about twice a much. Amazon was good about the return, but this should be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pouring it out of the caraf is not easy
customer_reviews.text: It does not pour out, rather runs down the side to the bottom, creating a mess and a challenge. It will pour correctly if you pour it mostly at one time and quick. I was really surprised that this item can not be returned. Major disappointment. I was pretty excited when I first saw it and read a few of the reviews. Clearly, I should have read the bad as well as the good. I've never made a purchase on Amazon that could not be returned - lesson learned the hard way!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Item, it's legit too
customer_reviews.text: We bought a classic and a handblown to compare, it's very obvious different looking and the quality is there. The handblown (13 cup one) is thick, heavier, and clearly less likely to shatter. The Classic is thinner, has a bigger seam and has inconsistent edging lengths in the carafe near the spout area. The handblown does have a seam, though a lot more subtle than it's classic counter part. The classic is lighter and sounds different when tapped, it also burns your hand when the coffee is freshly poured. Overall, it's a Chemex, so the quality is perfect if you buy nice coffee and know how to pour correctly. Highly recommend, it's extra work for a better cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Lewka

customer_reviews.title: My favorite coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is my third chemex, the first 2 were classic which broke during handling prompting the hand blown glass chemex as an attempt to prevent breaking easily. I love this system, obviously I've had three. The reviews for the hand blown had a lot of complaints about not receiving the correct model. I did not have this issue as well as receiving it within 24 hours. The chemex cuts the bitterness of coffee which can also cut the bolder body flavor. I usually use a medium and dark roast combined to get that bolder flavor. I know it's not great for the environment, but I do prefer the paper filters over the metal reusable. Overall I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Received cheaper Classic Version, NOT Handblown
customer_reviews.text: Paid higher price for product advertised as HANDBLOWN but received CLASSIC instead. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Watermark

customer_reviews.title: This is the CLASSIC model!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, this product is mislabeled. This is NOT the hand blown model as advertised but rather the classic model sold at the hand blown price. I thought I’d be safe from this since this shipped with Prime but I was fooled like other people have mentioned. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Yet another buyer who received Classic, not handblown
customer_reviews.text: Well, box says classic, measurements (according to Chemex site) scream classic. I paid for handblown, recieved classic. Disappointed to say the least. Maybe good news is the price went up, so maybe actually shipping handblown? I'd recommend the additional $5 and order from Chemex directly and not go through this hassle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Produces the cleanest cup of coffee I have ever had. There are no "off" or bitter tastes from coffee that comes from this. It takes a little longer to brew, total process is around 5 minutes, but well worth the time. This just makes a simple, clean cup of coffee with simple cleanup and no parts for coffee to get caught in and go rancid....
customer_reviews.author: Running love

customer_reviews.title: Not handblown

customer_reviews.title: I Recieved a Cheaper, Inferior Product
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong product, like many others have noted. I paid for the Handblown Model but received the much cheaper Classic model. This has happened multiple times to many people. I would suggest buying from someone else to ensure you receive the correct product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Zenner

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker That Feels More Durable Than the Classic Series
customer_reviews.text: The glass is thicker than what you find with the mold version of the Chemex coffee makers. It's much closer to the thickness of the Bodum brand glass coffee makers. This let's the coffee retain the heat better and it feels more sturdy in my hand. Less likely to break or chip. A lot of the negative reviews mention they received the wrong product. I'm not sure why you would review this product negatively if you didn't even get the correct product. Go review the seller negatively and work it out with them to get the correct version of the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jared S

customer_reviews.title: Sent classic instead of handblown
customer_reviews.text: They didn’t send the hand blown model. They sent the classic version, so make sure you check yours! It’s easy to tell the difference, as it will say “classic” in the box, and it feels much lighter. Bummer because this seemed like a good deal - too good to be true as they say.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware

customer_reviews.title: Beware!

customer_reviews.title: Coffee in the AM

I had a 6-cup brewer and this is 8 cups; I like the extra space if I need it. Functions perfectly. It could be me, but the handle seems slightly larger and harder to grip than the 6-cup. I believe this is worth its price and seems more solidly made than the classic.

I got a grinder that has a reservoir to hold beans and dial the number of cups. Kind of like a brainless system, but it works for me and I don't have to measure. And out comes the best coffee ever, almost any bean comes out good. I use the chemed white filters. And I am set.

customer_reviews.title: They don't make 'em like they used to
customer_reviews.text: Just a word to newcomers. The "handblown" Chemex is no longer as durable as it used to be. They moved production to Hungary, and it's just regular silica glass. It's thicker and nicer than the machine blown model, but it breaks a lot easier than it used to. They used to be made out of the same stuff as Pyrex, but Pyrex isn't even made of that stuff anymore, so what can I say? You're getting looks for the extra money, not long life.

Highly recommend! If your concerned about time, I might pass.

Well worth the money.

customer_reviews.title: Little pricey but great coffee
